snippet: Israel’s response to the Charlie Hebdo attack has touched off a divisive new chapter in the war of words between allies turned rivals.
abstract: Turkey and Israel, onetime allies turned fierce rivals, continue series verbal assaults, with Turkish Prime Min Ahmet Davutoglu equating Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's actions against Palestinians with terrorist attacks in Paris.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Israel’s response to the Charlie Hebdo attack has touched off a divisive new chapter in the war of words between allies turned rivals.

headline.main: Killings Deepen Rift as Turks Accuse Netanyahu of ‘Crimes Against Humanity’
headline.print_headline: Killings Deepen Rift as Turks Accuse Netanyahu of ‘Crimes Against Humanity’
